messages: b7bdb6922e72ca0e423e12562bec0e2e (14:01): what's the diff between div and span ?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (14:02): Div is a block element. It's for grouping things.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (14:02): Span is an inline element. It's for marking up a span of inline content.
b7bdb6922e72ca0e423e12562bec0e2e (14:03): div can block groups of elements, right ?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (14:03): You can put nearly anything inside, yes
25ec83dc22b50211f44fba280866f8c6 (14:16): (Navid) Can u change background-image size in css?
25ec83dc22b50211f44fba280866f8c6 (14:16): (Navid) or does it have to be done when doing the <div> tag?
25ec83dc22b50211f44fba280866f8c6 (14:26): you can use tables inside frames and vise versa
b7bdb6922e72ca0e423e12562bec0e2e (14:26): i am trying to do <FORM><TABLE>table stuff</TABLE></FORM>\
b7bdb6922e72ca0e423e12562bec0e2e (14:27): all i can do is <TABLE><TR><TD><FORM>stuff</FORM></TD></TR></TABLE>
8886db30322a8d054756761614a136a9 (14:27): you'll not be able to do <table><tr><form><td>...</td></tr><tr><form><td> ...
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (14:27): A table is valid inside a form...
8886db30322a8d054756761614a136a9 (14:27): you can do <form><table>... without a problem
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (14:29): Yes. And that's what the validator is for.
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (14:29): validation: Validate at http://validator.w3.org/ for (X)HTML, http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/ for CSS
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (14:29): lylo: The rows and cols attributes on textarea are required.
8886db30322a8d054756761614a136a9 (14:29): because the dtd would complain otherwise
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (14:29): It should not be <input /> unless lylo is working in XHTML - which is usually a bad idea.
b7bdb6922e72ca0e423e12562bec0e2e (14:29): Dorward, that's just for an example. don't take it literally
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (14:30): lylo: Then don't paste code as if it's what you intend.
8886db30322a8d054756761614a136a9 (14:30): ok, forms where the one that could not contain inline content, then
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (14:30): And stop using caps already. Our eyes hurt enough at this time of night anyway
b7bdb6922e72ca0e423e12562bec0e2e (14:31): alright. that's clear for me. thanx guys. and sorry for the inconvenience :)
